item.title: Zenless Zone Zero 2.2 Release Date & Time (ZZZ 2.2 Maintenance Start & End Time)
item.description:
Seed and Orphie and Magus are both members of the Obol Squad in Zenless Zone Zero . This means that Soldier 11, Soldier 0, and Trigger will all have new Agents to pair with from their faction. Proxies who are looking forward to the new additions to Obol Squad can look forward to ZZZ 2.2 release date and maintenance end time ​​​​​​.

When Is ZZZ 2.2 Coming Out? - Zenless Zone Zero 2.2

ZZZ 2.2 will come out on September 2, 2025 (UTC-4 or earlier) , or September 3, 2025 (UTC-3 or later) . To put it simply, here's ZZZ 2.2 release date:

  • American time zone: September 2, 2025.
  • European time zone: September 3, 2025.
  • Asian time zone: September 3, 2025.

Seed Banner Release Date In ZZZ - Zenless Zone Zero

Seed Release Date In ZZZ: September 2, 2025 – September 24, 2025 (Phase 1)

Seed Debut

Trigger Rerun

Seed banner in ZZZ begins on September 2, 2025, for players in the American time zone (September 3 for those in European or Asian time zones). Seed's debut will be accompanied by another Obol squad member. Trigger in Zenless Zone Zero is an Electric-Stun Agent that excels in off-field Daze building and Aftershock damage.

Check out this Zenless Zone Zero banner article for more information about the next or past ZZZ banners.

ZZZ 2.2 Maintenance Ends & Start Time - Zenless Zone Zero 2.2

ZZZ 2.2 maintenance is expected to end at these times, if the countdown lasts for five hours.

300 Polychrome compensation in ZZZ will be available in the mailbox after the 2.2 version is up.

item.title: Metal Gear Solid Delta Sidesteps One of The Twin Snakes’ Biggest Pitfalls
item.description:
In addition to being a remake of one of the series' most beloved entries, Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater is a big deal for being the first remake the series has gotten in more than 20 years. Prior to Metal Gear Solid Delta , the Metal Gear Solid series had only ever gotten one genuine remake with 2004's Metal Gear Solid: The Twin Snakes , and to say that player reception to the title was mixed is a bit of an understatement. While the gameplay of The Twin Snakes was great, Silicon Knights' handling of the game's direction and audio has ultimately soured fans' perception of the title in the intervening years since its release.

Outside its initial GameCube version, Metal Gear Solid: The Twin Snakes has been lost to time, relegated to being a relic of the past thanks to its place as an oddity within the franchise. Visually and mechanically, Twin Snakes does a great job updating the campaign of Metal Gear Solid , but the decision to re-record the game's voice acting and reframe the direction of the game's cutscenes resulted in it being a tonal mess that took a lot of the weight out of the original's story. Metal Gear Solid Delta wisely avoids these issues by opting to leave the original audio alone, and it's a better remake for it.

Metal Gear Solid Delta's Audio Treatment Honors Both the Game and Its Cast

Development on Metal Gear Solid: The Twin Snakes began in a post- Metal Gear Solid 2 world, which inspired Silicon Knights and Konami to try to retrofit Sons of Liberty 's framework onto the original Metal Gear Solid . In terms of how this impacted the game's mechanics, there were mostly welcome additions like first-person aiming, but the studio then took it upon itself to re-record the game's voice acting, complete with recasting some of Metal Gear Solid 's original talent. The result is that Twin Snakes both fails to match the tonality of the original Metal Gear Solid and doesn't do right by the game's legacy voice cast.

Conversely, Metal Gear Solid Delta immediately stands out as the superior Metal Gear Solid remake thanks to its use of the original audio from Snake Eater . The entire original voice cast is still front and center in Metal Gear Solid Delta , with their lines simply remastered for HD audio rather than re-recorded, and still just as great as they've always been.

It's hard to imagine Snake Eater without David Hayter's iconic performance as Naked Snake or Lori Alan as The Boss, and thanks to Virtuos' handling of Metal Gear Solid Delta , players don't have to.

Snake Eater's Arthouse Take on a Spy Thriller is Better Than Ever in Metal Gear Solid Delta

The same care and attention paid to honoring the original Snake Eater 's audio and voice acting carries over to Metal Gear Solid Delta 's cutscenes as well, which, aside from their substantial visual uplift, are shot-for-shot remakes of Metal Gear Solid 3 's. It's an important distinction to make from how other remakes approach their source material, as Hideo Kojima's artistic vision is still front and center in Metal Gear Solid Delta and a major component of the game's appeal, even without his direct involvement.

Kojima's penchant for cinematic flair made the Metal Gear Solid series an innovator when it came to storytelling in interactive media, and Metal Gear Solid 3 was always seen as the creator's high point for how it blends elements of more artistic and thought-provoking films with the iconic spy thrillers of the 1960s. Metal Gear Solid Delta 's decision to honor that vision and update it without altering it only serves to hammer home the point that Snake Eater is a game still ahead of its time and the pinnacle of its franchise, its visuals now matching the quality of the content like a long-awaited 4K remaster of a classic film.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Steam Player Count is Down 86% From Its Peak
item.description:
The Steam player count for Marvel Rivals has fallen off dramatically since the game's peak in January, with nearly 90% of the game's playerbase seeming to have left the shooter behind. The team-based hero shooter featuring a wide cast of beloved Marvel characters took the gaming world by storm following its launch as one of the hottest competitive online games. The shooter only needed three days to eclipse 10 million players worldwide and earned more than $135 million within just the first month following its release. However, Marvel Rivals ' player count today is a far cry from its peak.

While Marvel Rivals saw a meteoric rise to popularity following its debut, the months since its launch have not been without issues for the game. Marvel Rivals has seen an uptick in negative reviews from fans throughout recent months, with many attributing the game's issues to poor performance and balancing. Developer NetEase Games also recently made a major change to Marvel Rivals ' matchmaking system, limiting the team size players can queue with in higher ranks and receiving significant backlash from the community. Now, Marvel Rivals ' recent struggles have extended to its player counts on Steam.

Recent player count information from SteamDB shows just how drastically the playerbase for Marvel Rivals on Steam has fallen. SteamDB currently shows Marvel Rivals ' peak player count throughout the past 24 hours with 87,948 players logging into the Marvel shooter. While a respectable number of players are still logging games in Rivals , the count shows a steep 86% decrease from the game's peak player count in January, where over 644,000 players were playing Marvel Rivals . Despite the sharp decline, Marvel Rivals still sits in the top 10 most-played games on Steam, according to SteamDB.

Marvel Rivals Player Count Has Dropped Significantly

  • 24-hour Peak Player Count : 87,498 Players
  • All-time Peak Player Count : 644,269 Players

The decline of Marvel Rivals could be owed to many factors, some of which are entirely beyond the developers' control. New games often see a notable decline in players when the excitement around the game's launch dies down, with players moving on to other games following Marvel Rivals . Many of the game's updates have likely taken a toll on the player count, with players repeatedly complaining about Marvel Rivals ' balancing as NetEase continues to add new playable characters.

While Marvel Rivals has seen a sharp decline in its playerbase, NetEase Games still has plenty for players who stick around with the Marvel shooter. Recent rumors have heavily implied that beloved antihero Deadpool may soon be coming to Marvel Rivals , with several voicelines discovered to mention the Wade Wilson hero. Marvel Rivals is also gearing up for the launch of its next competitive season, with Season 4 set to officially begin in early September. While the game may not boast the same overwhelming popularity from its peak, Marvel Rivals looks to have lots on the way for its remaining fans.

item.title: Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar - How to Get and Use Gold Medals
item.description:
In Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar , there are many different collectibles and rewards that help you grow your farm and stand out at the weekly market. Among these, Gold Medals are one of the most valuable items you can earn. Unlike the basic Medals, Gold Medals are harder to come by but are far more useful. This guide covers every reliable method of getting Gold Medals in SoS: Grand Bazaar and how you can use them effectively.

How to Get Gold Medals in Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar

Gold Medals are the highest tier of medals, and unlike regular ones, they’re usually tied to specific achievements or hidden locations. Here’s where you can find them:

Completing Achievements

Certain achievements in Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar will reward you with Gold Medals. These achievements take time and consistency, so it’s worth working towards them alongside your daily farm work. Here are the achievements to look out for:

Achievement Title

Objective

Green Thumb

Harvest a Rare crop

Bouncer

Jump 5,000 times

Big-Catcher

Catch at least 3 species of fish at maximum size

Exploring the Overworld

Gold Medals can also be discovered in special locations around Zephyr Town. By interacting with unique landmarks, you’ll be rewarded with medals.

Here are some spots to check out:

  • Interact with the cow sign at the entrance to your farm.
  • Interact with the Clock Tower in town.
  • Interact with the Bazaar sign on the lower-right side of the map.
  • Interact with Mayor Felix’s statue at the center of the bazaar.

How to Use Gold Medals in Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar

Gold Medals are incredibly valuable resources with several uses. Each Gold Medal sells for 1,500 Gold, making them one of the most lucrative single items in the early and mid-game. If you need a quick cash boost to invest in seeds, animals, or bazaar upgrades, selling Gold Medals is a solid option.

Besides selling, some villagers appreciate receiving medals as gifts. Handing out Gold Medals can quickly increase friendship points and help progress certain relationships.

Later in the game, medals gain even more importance. It’s entirely up to you whether you sell them for quick cash or save them for long-term rewards.

item.title: Street Fighter 6 Reveals Monster Hunter Collaboration Event
item.description:
Street Fighter 6 and Monster Hunter Wilds are teaming up again, but this time in the Street Fighter universe. Capcom has revealed that Street Fighter 6 will host a month-long collaboration starting September 1, and fans of both series can expect loads of content celebrating Monster Hunter Wilds .

Fans of Akuma from Street Fighter 6 had the chance to become the character in Monster Hunter Wilds in a previous collaboration in May. The free DLC gave Monster Hunter Wilds players a chance to use their fists to take down the powerful monsters. Chun-Li and Cammy were available as paid DLC in the Monster Hunter Wilds X Street Fighter 6 collaboration.

Street Fighter 6’s Monster Hunter Collab Details

  • Five new EX colors based on popular Monster Hunter Wilds monsters
  • Battle Hub voting event from September 1-September 15 to earn weapon accessories, titles, and emotes
  • Free challenger screen effects, sound effects, stickers, and wallpapers
  • Battle Hub themes and photo spots to commemorate the event
  • Monster Hunter- themed Fighting Pass
  • New avatar gear

Street Fighter 6 players will have a lot of options for this event with Monster Hunter Wilds . Players can purchase five EX colors for Blanka, Akuma, Manon, Cammy, and Ken inspired by different monsters from Monster Hunter Wilds . All players that log in during the collaboration period will receive a challenge screen effect, Quest Start sound effect, 10 stickers, and two wallpapers. The Battle Hub will be decorated with a Monster Hunter Wilds theme, and players can visit photo spots to take commemorative photos with Rathalos and Rathian from Monster Hunter Wilds .

While in the Battle Hub, players can also vote for which is stronger – the White Wraith or Demon. Voting can gain players weapon accessories including the Hope Blade, seven titles including Mmm, so tasty!, and two emotes: Hunter’s Applause and Hunter Hula. The Monster Hunter- themed Fighting Pass returns to Street Fighter 6 and will include avatar gear, emotes, and titles. And finally, new avatar gears will be added to The Shop that includes Rathalos color sets and Felyne color sets.

As of now, there’s no word on how much the new EX colors or the avatar gears will cost. Street Fighter 6 fans had previously complained about the TMNT skins, with each skin costing $15 apiece. Unlike the TMNT collaboration, the Monster Hunter Wilds EX colors are for the fighters themselves, so players may be more willing to spend the money on this one-time collab. Players will have the chance to gain avatar gear based around Rathalos through the Fighting Pass if they don’t want to purchase the gear itself, but the exclusive colors will only be available in The Shop.

The Street Fighter 6 X Monster Hunter Wilds collaboration comes on the heels of the Street Fighter 6 collab with K-Pop group Aespa. Players previously noted that the Juri skin featured in the team-up meant that Juri had the most outfits in the game, so fans might be relieved to see other fighters getting their spotlight.
